title: Implement core bd executor
description: Create an async function in lua/nvim-beads/core.lua to execute bd commands via vim.system, parse JSON output, and handle errors properly.
design: Use vim.system() with text=true option for clean output. JSON parsing with pcall for error handling. Function signature: execute_bd(args, opts) where args is table of command arguments.
acceptance_criteria:
- core.lua exports an execute_bd() function
- Function uses vim.system() for async execution
- Parses JSON output using vim.json.decode()
- Returns parsed data on success
- Returns nil + error message on failure
- Handles both command failures and JSON parse errors

title: Integration test for preview functionality
description: Verify that the preview functionality works correctly end-to-end in a real Neovim session with actual bd data. Can be manual testing initially, automated later if needed.
design:
Manual testing checklist:
1. Open Neovim in a project with bd initialized
2. Run :Beads command
3. Use j/k to navigate through issues
4. Verify preview pane shows on the right
5. Check that preview content uses correct format:
   - YAML frontmatter with type (not issue_type)
   - Single # headings (not ##)
   - Dependencies in frontmatter, not markdown body
   - Parent shown separately in frontmatter when present
6. Test with different issue types (bug, feature, task)
7. Test with issues that have/don't have optional fields (parent, labels, design, etc.)
8. Verify syntax highlighting works
9. Test error handling (e.g., malformed issue data)

Document any issues found for follow-up tasks
acceptance_criteria:
- Manual test run completed in real Neovim session
- Preview shows correct content format per requirements doc section 3.2
- Verified single # headings (not ##)
- Verified dependencies in YAML frontmatter (not markdown)
- Verified parent field separate from dependencies when present
- Verified issue_type -> type field name transformation
- Syntax highlighting works properly
- No Lua errors when navigating picker
- Performance is acceptable (no noticeable lag)
- Issues/bugs documented as new bd tasks if found
- Can optionally create automated integration test if time permits

title: Implement issue formatter with full metadata
description: Implement format_issue_to_markdown(issue) function in lua/nvim-beads/issue.lua that converts a bd issue table into a list of strings representing YAML frontmatter followed by Markdown body content.
design:
Function signature: format_issue_to_markdown(issue) -> string[]

Output format must match requirements doc section 3.2 exactly:

```
---
id: bd-1
title: My Issue Title
type: feature
status: open
priority: 2
parent: bd-100
dependencies:
  - bd-120
  - bd-121
labels:
  - ui
  - backend
created_at: 2023-10-27T10:00:00Z
updated_at: 2023-10-27T12:00:00Z
closed_at: null
---

# Description

A clear, detailed explanation of the issue.

# Acceptance Criteria

A list of criteria that must be met for the issue to be considered complete.

# Design

Technical design notes or implementation plan.

# Notes

Any other relevant information.
```

Key requirements:
- Use `type` in frontmatter (not `issue_type` - transform from bd JSON)
- Use single `#` for section headings (not `##`)
- Dependencies go in YAML frontmatter as list (not markdown section)
- Parent is separate frontmatter field (not in dependencies)
- All timestamps use ISO format with Z timezone
- Optional fields: parent, labels, closed_at, assignee, description, design, acceptance_criteria, notes
- Omit empty/null sections entirely
acceptance_criteria:
- issue.lua module exists with format_issue_to_markdown function
- Returns array of strings (one per line) for buffer insertion
- YAML frontmatter uses `type` field (mapped from bd's `issue_type`)
- Section headings use single # (not ##)
- Dependencies list in YAML frontmatter (not markdown body)
- Parent shown separately in frontmatter when present
- Timestamp fields: created_at, updated_at, closed_at
- Optional sections omitted when null/empty
- Function uses types from types.lua
- Output matches requirements doc section 3.2 exactly

title: Create type definitions module (types.lua)
description: Create lua/nvim-beads/types.lua module with type definitions and documentation for issue data structures used throughout the plugin. This will serve as the single source of truth for what fields exist on issue objects.
design:
Create lua/nvim-beads/types.lua with EmmyLua annotations.

Key type definitions needed:

1. **Issue** - Main type matching bd show --json output:
   ```lua
   ---@class Issue
   ---@field id string
   ---@field title string
   ---@field description string|nil
   ---@field design string|nil
   ---@field acceptance_criteria string|nil
   ---@field notes string|nil
   ---@field status "open"|"in_progress"|"blocked"|"closed"
   ---@field priority integer (0-4)
   ---@field issue_type "bug"|"feature"|"task"|"epic"|"chore"
   ---@field assignee string|nil
   ---@field labels string[]|nil
   ---@field created_at string (ISO 8601)
   ---@field updated_at string (ISO 8601)
   ---@field closed_at string|nil (ISO 8601)
   ---@field external_ref string|nil
   ---@field dependencies Dependency[]|nil
   ---@field dependents Dependency[]|nil
   ```

2. **Dependency** - Dependency relationship type:
   ```lua
   ---@class Dependency
   ---@field id string
   ---@field title string
   ---@field dependency_type "blocks"|"related"|"parent-child"|"discovered-from"
   ```

Note: The `parent` field shown in requirements doc frontmatter is derived from dependencies array where dependency_type == "parent-child"
acceptance_criteria:
- types.lua exists in lua/nvim-beads/
- Contains EmmyLua type annotations for Issue and related types
- All fields from bd JSON output are documented
- Type definitions can be required by other modules
- LSP provides autocompletion when using these types

title: Add unit tests for issue formatter
description: Create comprehensive unit tests for the format_issue_to_markdown function in spec/nvim-beads/issue_spec.lua using busted test framework.
design:
Test cases to cover (using busted framework):

1. **Full issue with all fields** - Verify complete YAML frontmatter and all 4 markdown sections
2. **Minimal issue** - Only required fields (id, title, type, status, priority, created_at, updated_at)
3. **Issue with parent and dependencies** - Verify parent field separate from dependencies list in frontmatter
4. **Issue with labels** - Verify YAML list format for labels
5. **Issue with closed_at** - Verify closed issue shows closed_at timestamp
6. **Empty optional fields** - Verify description/design/acceptance_criteria/notes sections omitted when null
7. **Multi-line content** - Verify multi-line strings in description/design/etc preserved correctly
8. **Single # headings** - Assert sections use `# Description` not `## Description`
9. **Field name mapping** - Verify `issue_type: task` in bd JSON becomes `type: task` in frontmatter

Each test:
- Create sample issue table matching bd JSON schema
- Call format_issue_to_markdown
- Assert YAML frontmatter structure
- Assert markdown section headings use single #
- Assert dependencies in frontmatter, not body
- Verify no ## headings appear in output
acceptance_criteria:
- spec/nvim-beads/issue_spec.lua exists
- All 9+ test cases implemented
- Tests verify single # headings (not ##)
- Tests verify dependencies in YAML frontmatter
- Tests verify parent as separate frontmatter field
- Tests verify issue_type -> type mapping
- Tests pass with busted
- Can run with: busted spec/nvim-beads/issue_spec.lua

title: Implement Telescope buffer previewer
description: Add a buffer previewer to the Telescope beads_picker that shows formatted issue content when hovering over issues in the list. Uses bd show --json to fetch full issue data and format_issue_to_markdown to display it.
design:
In lua/telescope/_extensions/nvim_beads/init.lua:

1. Import previewers from telescope
2. Create previewer using previewers.new_buffer_previewer({
     title = "Issue Preview",
     define_preview = function(self, entry, status)
       - Extract issue_id from entry.value
       - Call bd show --json <issue_id> asynchronously
       - Parse JSON response
       - Call format_issue_to_markdown(issue)
       - Write lines to preview buffer (vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines)
       - Set filetype to markdown for syntax highlighting
       - Handle errors gracefully (show error message in preview)
     end
   })
3. Add previewer to beads_picker configuration

Performance: Keep simple for now (no caching), bd show is fast enough
acceptance_criteria:
- Telescope picker shows preview pane when enabled
- Hovering over issue in list shows formatted content in preview
- Preview contains YAML frontmatter with correct format per requirements doc section 3.2
- Preview shows single # headings for Description/Design/Acceptance Criteria/Notes sections
- Dependencies shown in YAML frontmatter, not markdown body
- Markdown syntax highlighting is applied
- Preview updates when cursor moves to different issue
- Errors from bd show are displayed gracefully
- Works with existing :Beads command
